    • Method Detail

      • scan

        public void scan()
        Description copied from interface: StorageEntityScanCursor
        Initializes this cursor so that it will scan over all existing entities. Each call to StorageCursor.next() will advance the cursor so that the next entity is read.
        Specified by:
        scan in interface StorageEntityScanCursor<AllNodeScan>

      • single

        public void single​(long reference)
        Description copied from interface: StorageEntityScanCursor
        Initializes this cursor so that the next call to StorageCursor.next() will place this cursor at that entity.
        Specified by:
        single in interface StorageEntityScanCursor<AllNodeScan>
        Parameters:
        reference - entity to place this cursor at the next call to StorageCursor.next().

      • scanBatch

        public boolean scanBatch​(AllNodeScan scan,
                         int sizeHint)
        Description copied from interface: StorageEntityScanCursor
        Initializes this cursor to perform batched scan. The upper bound of the number of found entities, is given by the provided size hint. The provided SCAN can be shared among worker-threads where each thread has a separate cursor. The role of scan is to make sure we don't get overlapping ranges.
        Specified by:
        scanBatch in interface StorageEntityScanCursor<AllNodeScan>
        Parameters:
        scan - scan maintains state across threads so that we get exclusive ranges for each batch.
        sizeHint - the batch will try to read this number of entities.
        Returns:
        true if there are entities to be found, otherwise false

      • relationshipsReferenceWithDenseMarker

        static long relationshipsReferenceWithDenseMarker​(long nextRel,
                                                  boolean isDense)
        Marks a relationships reference with a special flag if the node is dense, because if that case the reference actually points to a relationship group record.

      • degrees

        public void degrees​(RelationshipSelection selection,
                    Degrees.Mutator mutator,
                    boolean allowFastDegreeLookup)
        Description copied from interface: StorageNodeCursor
        Visits degrees, i.e. number of relationships, for relationships of the given selection and gives those degrees to the mutator.
        Specified by:
        degrees in interface StorageNodeCursor
        Parameters:
        selection - RelationshipSelection to get degrees for.
        mutator - to given the degrees to.
        allowFastDegreeLookup - set to false if there's a need to do security checks, which require the lookup to be done with traversal.

      • supportsFastDegreeLookup

        public boolean supportsFastDegreeLookup()
        Description copied from interface: StorageNodeCursor
        NOTE the fact that this method is here means physical details about underlying storage leaks into this API. However this method has to exist as long as the kernel API also exposes this. This needs to change at some point.
        Specified by:
        supportsFastDegreeLookup in interface StorageNodeCursor
        Returns:
        whether or not this node is dense.

      • setForceLoad

        public void setForceLoad()
        Description copied from interface: StorageCursor
        Force loading of the data and ignore errors, even when the datums are unavailable (like not-in-use records) or cannot be properly loaded or decoded. This must ONLY be used by the consistency checker. This method must be called after any cursor initializing call, such as scan, single, or init, and before any call to StorageCursor.next(). A call to StorageCursor.reset() will undo this call.
        Specified by:
        setForceLoad in interface StorageCursor

      • propertiesReference

        public long propertiesReference()
        Specified by:
        propertiesReference in interface StorageEntityCursor
        Returns:
        a long reference to start reading properties for the entity this cursor is at.

        Description copied from interface: StorageEntityCursor
        Initializes StoragePropertyCursor for reading properties of this entity.
        Specified by:
        properties in interface StorageEntityCursor
        Parameters:
        propertyCursor - StoragePropertyCursor to initialize.

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Description copied from interface: StorageCursor
        Positions this cursor and reads the next item that it has been designated to read.
        Specified by:
        next in interface StorageCursor
        Returns:
        true if the item was read and in use, otherwise false.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: StorageCursor
        Resets state in this cursor so that calls to StorageCursor.next() will not return true anymore. After this point this cursor can still be used, after initializing it with any of the cursor-specific initialization method.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface StorageCursor
